title.narrative: OP2: Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN RURAL COMMUNITIES

description.narrative: By 2021, Ministries and departments at national and sub national level have increased capacity to create demand for, and deliver and monitor water, sanitation services and promote hygiene behavior in rural communities, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged children and their families have equitable access to and use of sustainable improved water sources, sanitation facilities, and adopt hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, Ministries and departments at national and sub national level have increased capacity to create demand for, and deliverand monitor water, sanitation services and promote hygiene behavior in rural communities

description.narrative: Hygiene messages were provided to over four million people through social media throughout the COVID-19 pandemic and to villages throughout the country through the village messaging systems, radio and television. This was complemented by provision of resilient household water supplies to over 15,000 people in remote rural villages, the declaration and 41 villages as Open Defecation Free (ODF), and reflecting the growing national momentum in sanitation, the declaration of the first district in Saravane Province to be declared ODF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:01/02/2022
